title: TIME Announces Year of Growth in Advertising Revenue, Events and Strategic Partnerships
description: TIME CEO Jessica Sibley sent the following note to staff on Wednesday: On my first day as CEO—one year ago next week—I laid out our collective vision and strategy for TIME 3.0 with the following goals and priorities: In just 12 months, we’ve made significant progress in achieving these goals. Despite massive transformation across our…

title: Why Starbucks Workers Are Striking on One of the Busiest Days of the Year
description: "We won't work unless you provide us respectable conditions to work in."

title: Trump’s Lawyers Want a Mistrial in His New York Civil Fraud Case
description: His attorneys claim the judge is biased.

title: Countries May Be Getting One Step Closer To Actually Tackling Plastic Pollution
description: Nations are gathering in Nairobi to hammer out a binding treaty to deal with plastic pollution.

title: New Hampshire’s 2024 Primary Will Be Held on Jan. 23
description: The move extends its streak of going first despite national Democrats’ efforts to overhaul the nominating calendar.

title: Ukraine Races to Protect its Energy System from Russia’s Winter Attacks
description: As winter approaches, Ukrainians brace for yet another Russian attempt to freeze them out.

title: New York Sues PepsiCo Inc. for Plastic Pollution
description: PepsiCo produces and packages at least 85 different beverage brands including Gatorade and Pepsi products.

title: U.N. Security Council Schedules a Vote on a Resolution Urging Humanitarian Pauses in Gaza
description: The draft resolution makes no mention of a cease-fire.

title: How to Help People in Sudan Amid Warnings of ‘Another Genocide’
description: International aid organizations have warned of "another genocide" in Sudan after reports of mass killings and assaults.

title: YouTube to Require Creators to Disclose Use of Generative AI
description: Creators that don't disclose whether they've used AI tools to make “altered or synthetic” videos will face penalties including having their content removed or suspension from the platform's revenue sharing program.

title: Google CEO Sundar Pichai Testifies in Court for Second Time in 2 Weeks
description: In his latest court appearance in San Francisco, Sundar Pichai spent more than two hours defending the business practices of the Google Play Store

title: Peace is Possible for Israel and Gaza—If Their Leaders Want It
description: To defeat the zealots on both sides, we must help Palestinians and Israelis hope for peace.

title: A Volcano in Iceland Could Erupt Any Day. Here’s What to Know
description: Iceland is preparing for a possible volcanic eruption after hundreds of earthquakes have rocked the island nation in the North Atlantic.

title: What Civil War History Says About Attempts to Use the Insurrection Clause to Keep Trump From Office
description: Debates about handling Confederates reveal that the 14th Amendment bars unrepentant insurrectionists from office.

title: E.U. Reaches Deal To Cut Highly Polluting Methane Emissions From the Energy Sector
description: According to experts, one of the biggest causes of climate change is methane gas emissions — second only to carbon dioxide.

title: China and the U.S. Pledge To Step Up Climate Efforts
description: Cooperation between the world's two biggest emitters of greenhouse gases is considered vital to the success of the U.N. COP28 climate talks.

title: U.K. Supreme Court Rules Plan to Send Migrants to Rwanda Is Unlawful
description: Justices on the country’s top court ruled unanimously that asylum-seekers sent to Rwanda would be “at real risk of ill-treatment

title: Here’s What to Know About The U.K.’s Proposed Gaza Ceasefire Vote in the House of Commons
description: All eyes are on the House of Commons as the SNP is attempting to pass a motion for a vote calling for a ceasefire in Gaza.

title: Inside COP28’s Big ‘Experiment’: What Happens When You Put a Fossil Fuel Exec in Charge of Solving Climate Change
description: To hear the big oil CEO tell it, climate progress depends on market buy-in as much as international negotiations

title: Biden Is Leading on the Global Stage. Some Voters Aren’t Happy About It.
description: Biden is meeting with China's leader as US sentiment toward China is at an all-time low, and his efforts in Israel divide Americans

title: How Christianity Influenced America’s Notions of Equality
description: "'All men are created equal' coexisted comfortably with the understanding that not all were meant to be treated equally in life," writes Darrin McMahon.

title: How to End the Futile Blame Game Over Failed Long COVID Research
description: A pair of public health experts argue that the current approach to Long COVID research is failing, and offer a radical new paradigm.

title: Breaking Down the Debut Episodes of A Murder at the End of the World
description: Here's what happens in the first two episodes of creators Brit Marling and Zal Batmanglij’s new murder mystery series.

title: Philippine Prosecutor Subpoenas Ex-President Rodrigo Duterte Over Alleged Death Threat
description: The former President, once seemingly above the law, now must answer to a criminal complaint alleging he gravely threatened an opposition lawmaker.

title: Now Asia Is Facing a Bedbug Crisis
description: After they haunted Paris, bedbugs are now terrifying countries in Asia, where surges in infestations are fueling fresh anxieties and stirring governments to action.

title: Taiwan Opposition Parties Announce Alliance, Shaking Up January Election
description: A combined opposition campaign would reshape the January presidential election that could affect global geopolitics for years to come.

title: Israel’s Military Enters Gaza’s Largest Hospital for ‘Targeted Operation’
description: Military officials gave no further details but said they were taking steps to avoid harm to civilians. Hamas has denied the Israeli accusations that it uses the hospital for cover.
